12.content: Who leads this freakishly named kingdom?
12.title: Kingdom of Gol'Rok

choices: The sisters go on a quest for the crown
An Argolian Citizen finds the crown
A war breaks out between Argol and Queen Amber
A much more powerful being....Paqrant enters.
14.content:
The sun rose high above the kingdom. It was a lovely place, full of life, energy, people, and creatures of all kinds! But most importantly, it was a happy land. There was a large walk around the kingdom, and if one went through the gates they would see a long winding road that led up the hill to Argolin castle.

Along this road, carts and horses went back and forth. Many, smaller paths went away and led to rows and rows of huts, shops, and houses. There was a wide river that lazily ran along the eastern side of the city. Trees grew and animals flourished.

Inside the enormous castle, lived the leader of this village. His name was Marrin. Marrrin was a wizard, who was very old and was no longer able to cast the enchantments he once conjured. His old age had left him bed-ridden and grey. Also in the great castle, were the armies and weapons of Argol.

But outside this paradise, were great forces of darkness. Any Argolian caught outside the gates would never return. The evil queen Amber. She was usually busy hunting for her long lost crown of fate, and conjuring up new and vile beings. She was incredibly powerful. Legend had it that the crown she once dawned could make great balls of fire, and transform into the wearer into a dragon, or something far more powerful.

Queen Amber needed to reunite with her lost crown. It was the source of her destructive powers. If she did, even Marrin himself wouldn’t be able to match half her strength. Without out it, she was still fierce, but easily kept at bay by the defenses of Argol.

Amber once had a great army that conquered all the land. Within it were goblins, trolls, dragons, and her three daughters (each have a nickname that the Argols call them), who did her bidding and rained down evil:

- Cassius, (Sorceress) the eldest. Cassius was of equal size to Emmarus. She was the smartest, and most wise. She took after her mother, conjuring up spells from levitating, to shields, to magical swords.

- Emmarus, (Enchantress) the middle child. She was incredibly gifted at illusions. She could make a person see whatever she wanted and could play with minds.

- And finally, Princess Ava. (Gargantuess) Ava was the youngest, but she rose high above the others, at an awe-inspiring height. An army of a thousand elves would tremble before her. Using her formidable and incredible size, she could squash, wrestle, or use a sword to devastate anyone who faced her. The sister who was strongest, and by far the most muscular, who was capable of hurling boulders and crushing villages with her body.

Which path will you take, using these characters?
14.title: The World of Argol

choices: They travel to the outskirts of Argol
They search the Forrest of Despair
They look to the Western Fields
141.content:
Meanwhile, outside the gates of Argol, beyond the Forrest of despair, and the Western field, past the eternal pit, which could only be crossed by a small, narrow, creaky, bridge, lay the Realm of Queen Amber. It was a horrible place, full of monsters, demons, volcanoes, including a large and quite dangerous one called Mount Peril. Mount Peril, was where Queen Amber practiced her dark magic.

Beyond all of this, on a jagged, rocky hill, was the Castle of Queen Amber. On a particularly dark and dreary day, Amber summoned her daughters to the throne room. Her guards opened the doors. The three children entered the castle and made their way up the long winding corridors to the throne room.

“What do you think it is this time? Has mother found another village for us?” Said Emmarus.

Ava just laughed. Emmarus looked up at her sister. In fact, she had to look far up. Ava towered over her by many feet.

“What do you think then little sister?” Asked Emmarus.

“Oh sister. You may be my elder, as you so subtly pointed out, but you still do not understand. Mother has summoned us because she has found The Crown.”

“The Crown of Hades himself? I don’t believe so Ava. Your size and lust for power cloud your judgement. The Crown cannot and will not be found. That is certain.” Emmarus responded.

“Both of you,” said Cassius “may be correct. But indeed it is a matter of grave circumstances. I fear that The Crown itself must be found soon. Each day we dally Mother looses her strength. We must move fast if we are to regain our power.”

The two younger siblings were quiet. Their sister always had a way of speaking in a way that created an ensuing silence. They finally ascended to the throne room. The entered and saw their mother sitting in her lava throne.

“My children. Come. I must speak to you.” They approached with caution. Queen Amber looked frail and sickly. Her hair had begun to change from a long dirty blonde mane to wispy, silver strands. Her power had been drained.

“What is your bidding Mother. We are prepared.” Said Cassius. The three bowed and went to one knee. Amber rose from her throne and began to walk toward a window, which only let in dark, volcanic light.

“You disappoint me, my children.” She said. “You have failed to retrieve the one prize that I requested. You must explain yourselves, and then you must find The Crown. Before it’s too late.”

Emmarus looked up. “But mother, we have tried. Those blasted Argols always-“

“Those puny weaklings! You should have foreseen this! They are a minor annoyance. Do not forget that your power was given in the depths of Mt. Peril. It can be taken away. Now, you will find me the Crown by sundown tomorrow. If you fail, I will die, and your power will be gone.”

The daughters rose and bowed. They exited and began their quest. Where do they go first?
141.title: The sisters go on a quest for the crown

choices: Two enter and one stays behind
1412.content:
“But Mother, where shall we go? We have been unable to locate a map that will lead us to the Crown.” Said Ava.

The evil Queen cackled. She walked over to the corner of her throne room. She then open a long narrow basket. Inside, were various pieces of magical literature, and maps. She decided on one and pulled out a dusty parchment. She handed it to Cassius.

“What is this my Queen?” Asked Emmarus.

“That is your guide. I suggest you follow it.” Said Amber.

“But mother, this map is incomplete. It only details the paths through the Forrest of Despair! Are you telling us we must search the entire wood?” Asked Cassius.

“Daughter,” Said Queen Amber “you must look beyond the lines. I assure you that once inside the Forest you will understand what the purpose of the map is. I could retrieve the Crown, but I am too weak, and without the Crown itself, I do not have the power to find it.”

The three daughters vowed. Each made a promise that they would never let their Queen down. Amber reminded them of the consequences should they fail, before bidding them farewell.

The three sisters walked briskly out of the castle. All that was left was a journey. Their destination was about a days walk North. The first hour was silent.

“My dear sisters. I have had a most grave thought: When we retrieve this Crown, shall we use it ourselves?” Asked Ava.

“No. We mustn’t. It is for the head of the Queen. And the Queen only. Don’t be foolish, and don’t forget your place. You may be stronger, but I am 100 years your elder. You cannot let your lust cloud your judgement.” Said Cassius.

Ava remained silent until they reached the wood. It was almost nightfall, and the skies darkened. Nevertheless, they pressed on. They had to find the Crown this night.

They began to creep through the woods. Each moment there was a distant creaking or howl. They walked onward for what seemed like an eternity. They almost gave up. Suddenly, the came to a clearing.

“This is not on the Map.” Said Emmarus. She turned it upside down and sideways looking for the clearing. It was not to be found.

“This is it. It has to be. Our efforts shall be rewarded. I sense that the Crown is within our grasp!” Said Ava.

“Look! Ahead. There is a point in the center of the clearing that is lit far brighter by the moon. I have read stories about the writing of tree elves. You must put the map under this light. It will reveal the location we seek.” Said Cassius.

Emmarus ran over to the center. Indeed the moon was shining incredibly bright in the spot. She raised the map. The three watched in awe as red lines began to draw themselves on the map. The all converged at a spot not 50 feet away.

The hurried, following the map to a thick tangled cluster of bushes. Inside the protective layer, was a hole that led underground.
1412.title: They search the Forrest of Despair

142.content:
All the citizens of the village moved quickly. This guy had darkened and it was clear that an attack or storm of some kind had come. Members of the royal guard and army crowded the streets, directing traffic and helping people indoors. However, a certain person had been caught unprepared. This teenager had been wandering in the Lockland Woods, which were located behind the Argol castle.

This teen was known as a bit of a trouble maker. But who was it?

Was it.......

A) Peter? Peter is a 17 year old boy. He Ives with his sister and mother. Unfortunately, his father had been killed in a battle against the Trolls before Peter was 1. The Peter is a freckled, lanky boy, with messy dirty blonde hair. He stood at about 5’10, and weighed less than 150 pounds. He wore dirty, loose hanging clothes. He isn’t one to fight.

B) Sophie? Sophie is nearly the opposite of Peter. Instead of a lanky, weak kid, she was about as strong as they come. Sophie stood at an imposing height of 6’3. She was confident and muscular. She loves a good fight. As a member (a commander actually) of the army, she wears armor that looks likes a medieval knight (no mask). She has a serious tone and long blonde hair.
142.title: An Argolian Citizen finds the crown

choices: Bring the case to Marrin and the High Council.
Leave it and report this to authorities
1423.content:
Peter slowly walked along the river. He was headed for the Lockland Woods, which were behind the castle in the eastern corner of Argol. He admired the quiet, peaceful water, and the lush green trees. He suddenly heard a branch snap.

He spun around. “Who goes there?” He called. He began to cautiously creep forward. It was probably just a rabbit. But in this world you always had to be careful. He went forward. Suddenly, two large hands grabbed his shoulders from behind.

“Agghhgh! Help!” He screamed. As he struggled against the powerful iron hands, he thought he heard laughing. He definitely did. And he knew that laugh.

“It’s not funny Sophie! You scared me.” He said. The hands released him and he turned to face his attacker. She was wearing her usual battle armor, and her long blonde hair flowed back.

“Hey Peter! You know, it isn’t safe out here. You shouldn’t be alone or someone could surprise you!” She said with a giggle. Mark ignored her grin a and turned away.

Oh come on! Don’t be a poor sport!” Sophie called, jogging to catch up with him. Peter was still a little upset. He didn’t like that she had done that. Although, in all the years that they had known each other, Sophie always tried to show that she was above Peter.

They continued to walk in silence. Suddenly, they came out of the trees. It was dark and rocky, and when the river met the jagged edges, it crashed, sending waves ten feet high. In front of them, was a dark cave.

“What is this place? I’ve been in these woods hundreds of times but I’ve never seen this before. It almost looks like....” he didn’t finish. Sophie continued to move forward, telling Peter to wait for her to signal. She vanished into the cave.

“Sophie? Sophie? Sophie!!” Peter cried. After a moment, an echo cane out of the cave. “Get in here Peter!”

Peter ran in, using a hand on the wall to guide him. He eventually came to an enormous cavern. The ceilings were so high they could almost not be seen. Lava and black rocks made up the floor wall. Gold items, from coins to plates to bars, lay in please around the room. The floor could not be seen because there were so many items.

Sophie was standing across the hall. She had her back turned. Peter went to her. Suddenly, when he reached her, he saw what she did. It was a golden box, about the size of a briefcase, but taller. There were dark jewels around the edges.

“What is it?” Asked Peter.

“I think it might be....The Crown. And if it is....Peter, listen to me.” She said, turning to face him. “This is serious. We have to take this right now.” She picked up the case fade-in it’s resting place. The single light that’s came from the outside world had illuminated its platform.

What should they do?
1423.title: Sophie and Peter make a discovery

143.content:
“Incoming! AGGHGHHHHHHH!!!!” Screamed a soldier as a fireball rocked the wall.

The wall that had protected Argol for a 1000 years was beginning to crumble. Rows of dwarves, elves, and men marched into battle. They immediately entered heavy combat. Queen Amber has summoned an army of creatures that could match that of the Argolians. Her three daughters led the charge.

Meanwhile, in the Argolian War Room....

4 men and one woman sat around the table. A general for each race. Elves, Dwarves, and Humans, as well as the wizard Marrin, and the Queen of Argol.

“Gentlemen, we must retreat to the city immediately. The Forrest of Despair has fallen. Our armies in the Western fields have been encircled, and they are closing in on the gates. Our only success has been a raid on Mount Peril by our Special Forces. We rescued almost a hundred POWs, mainly Dwarves. We also managed to retrieve a One Stone. Our top riders are on their way now. It will prove invaluable.” Said the Elf General.

“My Captains report the same. We have captured the western bank of the river, but the Goblins are planning an invasion which will come any day now. They outnumber my troops 3-1, and have 1 of the sisters. I agree. We need to pull back and defend the city.”

“What resources have we left? General Manor?” Asked the Queen.

The Human general lowered his head. “Ma’am. We have a thousand Elves, 750 Dwarves, 500 men, 10 giants, and a few fairies, (40-50) that we have managed to train, in the field. We also have 450 soldiers of combined race here in Argol. All of whom are well supplied, and of course we have our weapon, should you choose to use it. I suggest that it be unleashed now! No delays.”

“No! We cannot risk it. We need to save it for our final defense!” The Dwarf said, slamming his fist.

“My people are dying! We need him now! Do not forget that the Humans welcomed your kind into our hearts and homes. We have lost everything. So I suggest, general, that you let me decide!” Screamed the human.

“Silence.” Marrin said, raising his hand. “My people, you mustn’t give in to hate. We must embrace each other. As for our ‘weapon’, it can only be used to save us, not to kill others.”

The generals nodded. “Now, I suggest we strategize and save our kingdom.” Marrin said, nodding with wisdom.

“Gentlemen, and your highness, we have but three courses of action:

1. We could send in our reserve troops. This will push the enemy back, but it will leave us vulnerable to attack here.

2. We could pull back and defend. This will give us time to prepare, and possibly find the Crown. We are nearing the location every passing second.

3. We unleash our greatest weapon. The Sword of Artemis. It can only be wielded by one. Commander Sophie, our top Human. We would have to summon her from her recent raid on Mt. Peril.
143.title: A war breaks out between Argol and Queen Amber

1431.content:
“We must send in our troops. We have no course of action each moment we delay, our men die and they make more monsters. Our only option is to destroy them here and now!” Said General Manor, the human.

“I agree.” Said General Doorin, the Dwarf.

The Queen nodded her head, as did Marrin. They agreed. Now the question was where did the send their limited resources?

“My Men on the Western Bank are exhausted. They have been waiting for an attack, staying on alert for the last 3 days. We need to relieve them.” Said General Doorin.

“Ah, but we must consider our most important objective. The battlefields of the Forrest of Despair and the Western fields are our largest battles. 75 percent of our recourses are there. It is falling and if we were to lose that then the road our city would lay unguarded.”

“I am the Queen. I shall decide this. Gentlemen, we are struggling in this campaign. But we must defeat the forces of evil, and keep Argol a free land. This is why I have decided to send our reserves to ____
1431.title: They send their reserves in.

14312.content:
“The Western Fields. It is our best option.”

The men nodded. They stood and bowed as Marrin and the Queen exited the room. The Dwarf quickly went to his best rider. “Remnill, deliver this letter to Captain Anderson. In case you lose it, it reads: We are sending reserves to the front. Pull back to Dungeon Bay and dig in. We will arrive by morning.”

The young man nodded, mounting his horse. He rode off, directly into the fire of battle.

..... The Next Day, on the Front ......

“Captain, we have good news. The reinforcements have arrived as promised.” Said an Elf. Before him stood the legendary Elf, First Commander Sprier. He had fought back against Queen Amber when she possessed the Crown. He now was a strategist, who had refused a promotion to commanding Elven General no less than three times.

“Well, Commander, how are things on the front?” Sprier spun around and faced his General. He saluted. They both smiled and shook hands.

“How are you General?” Asked Sprier.

“Listen, I have to be honest. This war is one we are losing. It is my opinion that we need to move forward, and quickly. We need to stop the Queen from producing any more troops.”

“I agree.”

“Good. Now what happened here? How did we lose our position outside the Forrest of Despair?”

"Well, a while ago they just stormed out of the woods. Our armies fought them over every inch, but it was just too much. Many of us fled here. The ones who didn't got massacred or enslaved. That was before we had beauties like those ones over there." He looked fondly at the nearby crossbows. "And I'm going to go back there soon. We took a beating, but I know the Dark Queen. This stuff here is just a warmup.”

The General nodded, and saluted. Commander Sprier looked outward to the horizon. He put his hand up to block the sun..

Suddenly, there was a blurry shape on the distance. Then, it separated into three different forms, which rapidly grew larger as they approached.

"My god, those are armored dragons I believe. ALL HANDS! Prepare for Battle! Boys, man the bows! Take those foul beasts out of the sky!” Cried Sprier.

The flapping of leathery wings was growing louder, along with the screeches of the dragons. The sound of wizzing arrows filled the air.

The noise was now very loud, and getting even louder. It reached a terrifying shrieking noise for a moment, before a line of fire scorched the Elves. A louder explosion answered and the shrieking passed.

More explosions, and then the beat of wings. The dragons were leaving the elves in ruins. Then the sounds of battle grew louder.

“AGHHH?!?”
“HELP ME, GAHHHH!”
BOOOOM!!!!!
“Save yours- AGHHGH!”

Then, the dragons landed. The attack halted. Suddenly the Argolians saw figures approach their position. Who?
14312.title: The Western Fields

1432.content:
(Just an overview of the Generals)

- General Sherman, the Elf and overall commander of the Forces in the Forrest of Despair, the Western Fields and in Queen Ambers Realm.

- General Manor, the Human and command in charge of Argolian Defense and the Lockland Woods.

- General Doorin, the Dwarf and commander of the River Forces.

....

“I agree with you General. We can lure them in and then destroy them with almost no losses. We must defend our city until we can locate The Crown of Hades. With that, the Sword of Artemis, and a One stone, we can win easily. We must be patient.” Said the Queen.

Marrin nodded, giving his approval. As did General Manor and The General of the Dwarves. The council decided, and adjourned. Each General immediately went to their armies head quarters.

....

In a field tent, a captain ran to the ringing phone.

“Yes sir?” He said.

“Commander, this is General Sherman. Bombard Retreat! I repeat fire the magic balls into their front lines and fall back to the gates.”

“Sir, we only have a few more magical blasts. Are you sure?” The captain asked.

“I’m sure. This order is from the very top. Use whatever you have to. Use your last potion bombs if necessary. Break their line and fall back. That’s an order!”

“Yes Sir! We won’t let you down.” He hung up the phone and ran to the nearby soldiers. He instructed them to blast the last of the fireballs and he told them to load their last rocks onto the catapults.

“Fire!!!” He cried, swinging his arm downward. They cut the ropes and boulder crashed into the advancing enemy.

“Fire 2!!!” He cried. They used a large wooden contraption that looked like a pot boiling on a stove. It fired a blast if fire, causing the goblins to erupt into flames. Next, archers rained down claimed and poisonous arrows.

The enemy began to retreat. Attacks like this happened nearly every other day, but there were so many enemies, that these almost never led to a victory.

Using this time, horses were quickly hooked up, and made ready. Carts and barrels of supplies were loaded all as soldiers began to run for the safety of Argol. The field was left covered in abandoned bows, crossbows, Wands, swords, and spears. The plan had begun.

Meanwhile, a group of elite scouts, the ones who raided Mt. Peril, were sent into the Forest of despair to find the Crown of Hades. What happens to these soldiers, led by the Amazon Sophie?
1432.title: Pull back and defend Argol

choices: Go for the Genie of Argol for three wishes
Band together an army to fight
144.content:
It was a dark time for Argol. The people were enslaved, the skies were dark, and a powerful enemy sat upon their throne. It was not the Dark Queen Amber who had taken over. Instead, it was in fact a more powerful being.

This being had toppled Ambers Empire in a matter of minutes. The being had crashed through the walls of Argol and rained destruction upon the armies in far less than a day.

This being was none other than Paqrant. Paqrant had been imprisoned in the dungeons of Mt. Peril for a thousand years. She was kept there by the combined Magic of Amber and Marrin. However, as Amber grew weak without her Crown, and Marrin grew weak with age, she was able to escape her bonds.

She quickly claimed all territories to be hers. She then entered the castle sat upon the throne. Her first act as Queen of Saraquin (what she called her new realm), was to chain all citizens and use them as slaves. To prevent trouble, she constantly strolled the grounds, daring anyone to defy her.

Paqrant was not to be messed with. She was born half human, half giant. She towered far above any opposition and she used her Magic to alter her appearance whenever she desired.

Now, as Paqrant controls the entire realm, a brave resistance, led by Queen Amber’s three daughters, General Sophie, and a rah tag group of elves, Dwarves, humans, and fairies fights back.

They must first decide how to stop her. They have but three choices to fight back against the tyrant Queen.

1. The can find the Crown of Hades

2. They can Summon the Genie of Argol.

3. They can recruit soldiers and storm the city.
144.title: Bow Down  before Paqrant the Great

choices: The great big bad disastrous spell
145.content:
How about these three? These are new storylines/locations/ characters.

1. Argol must investigate underwater in the River to find out what Queen Amber is doing in the murky depths. Let’s just say sea monsters may exist.

2. Queen Amber trues a new spell. The results are great for her, giving her awesome power. For Argol, they may have to fight an ultra powerful Queen of Evil.

3. Other. You aren’t happy. Something else.

info.description:
Hello, everyone! Here's some rules and guidelines:
No description of sex, cut to black instead.
Intense gore is allowed, but try to limit it if possible.
Historical accuracy is encouraged.
PvP is allowed, but make sure to not force your actions on the other person. (I.E "All their troops were slaughtered by the knights")

That's about it. Be as descriptive as possible. 100 points per review!
